text: you'll know what happened in washington
on january the 6th last year we all
watched a mob of president trump's
supporters stormed the capital in an
attempt to stop the certification of the
election result the belief the election
was stolen was widespread among
republican supporters it still is and
the idea has been relentlessly pushed by
donald trump before the election he
predicted it would be rigged and once
he'd lost he carried on
this is a case where they're trying to
steal an election they're trying to rig
an election and we can't let that happen
unless there's any doubt this isn't true
there's no evidence of widespread
electoral fraud but a lack of evidence
wasn't stopping the president or his
supporters and so when donald trump
called on people to head to washington
on january the sixth they did in their
thousands and we know what happened next
and the ramifications of that day have
been felt ever since first of all there
was an impeachment the house of
representatives charged mr trump with
incitement of insurrection the jurors in
the impeachment trial were america's
senators now some republicans had
already criticized donald trump there's
no question none
that president trump is practically
and morally
responsible
for provoking the events
of the day but in the end there was no
conviction the vast majority of
republican senators voted to acquit that
though would not be the only trial
connected to january the sixth the
justice department had begun its own
investigations and in the past year over
700 people have been arrested and
charged more than 70 have already been
sentenced there is a criticism of the
justice department that it focused on
the rioters themselves but less on those
who may have organized funded or incited
them
the department refutes that criticism
and also it's not the only source of
scrutiny of what happened on that day
the democratic majority in the house of
representatives that's the lower house
set up a committee comprised of seven
democrats and two republicans it began
its hearings in july its vice chair is
republican and fierce trump critic liz
cheney
if those responsible are not held
accountable
and if congress does not act responsibly
this will remain a cancer on our
constitutional republic well since july
hundreds of people have been interviewed
in private most agreed to talk some had
to be subpoenaed and two key people
refused to take part the first was steve
bannon donald trump's former
presidential advisor he was out of the
white house long before january the 6th
but not out of politics and in his
podcast the day before the attack he
said all hell is going to break loose
tomorrow just understand this all hell
is going to break loose tomorrow for
this and for other reasons too the
january the 6th committee wanted to talk
to him but steve bannon didn't want to
talk and has now been charged with
criminal contempt of congress to which
steve bannon has said this
if the administrative state wants to
take me on bring it because we're here
to fight this and we're going to go on
offense and you stand by you see how
we're going to go on offense okay
the second person to defy the committee
subpoena was president trump's former
chief of staff mark meadows he too has
been found in contempt of congress and
may also face criminal charges now mr
meadows had handed over thousands of
pages of records but then refused to
cooperate further but even that material
was revelatory we saw text messages he'd
received during the attack the fox news
host laura ingraham wrote this is
hurting all of us he is destroying his
legacy other messages were received the
day before the attack fox news host sean
hannity said i'm very worried about the
next 48 hours but there's one key figure
whose testimony and evidence remains
elusive
we don't know a whole lot about what
donald trump was doing reports are he
was watching television during the early
part
of the attack on the capitol the
question is why didn't he take any kind
of actions why did he wait so long to
respond to this
former president trump has perhaps
unsurprisingly refused to cooperate he's
taken legal action to block the release
of official white house communication
records these delays mean it's not
certain the committee will finish its
work before the midterm elections in
november and the politics of this remain
far from predictable while many
condemned what happened the idea that
underpinned what happened remains a year
on from the storming of the capital
polls showed two-thirds of republicans
believe voter fraud helped joe biden win
given that that didn't happen that
raises profound questions about one of
the two main parties in the world's most
high-profile democracy and the democrats
argue harm is already being done
the root cause of january 6th is still
with us today
it is the big lie
pushed by donald trump
that is undermining faith in our
political system but for all this
criticism for all the convictions of
those involved in the riot donald trump
remains the dominant political figure in
the republican party and it remains the
case that he believes america's
democracy was rigged and so do his
supporters and if you believe that you'd
be furious you'd be outraged and so the
emotion that drove january the 6th
remains and there's no reason to think
it won't manifest itself again
you
